subject: p11474065
History: -year-old female patient status post tracheoplasty via right chest performed on, check for interval change.
Findings: PA and lateral chest views obtained with patient in upright position. Comparison is made with the next preceding AP single view chest examination of. The heart size is at the upper limit of normal variation. The heart configuration suggests a relative prominence of the left ventricular contour, a finding which in conjunction with the moderately widened and elongated thoracic aorta suggests the possibility of systemic hypertension. There is no acute pulmonary congestion. In the right hemithorax pleural thickenings are identified and seen to clear along the lateral chest wall. This coincides with the previously described local resection of the posterior aspect of the fourth rib related to previously performed tracheal reconstruction. These post-operative changes have not undergone any significant interval change. No pneumothorax is present. On the lateral view the posterior pleural sinuses are free from any free fluid, pleural effusion.
Impression: Stable post-operative chest findings. No new acute infiltrates and no pneumothorax.
